hackathon-description-text: Today's most exciting use cases for blockchain technology extend far beyond payments and digital currency. New protocols that offer much more robust programming capabilities than bitcoin have ushered in the era of the "smart contract," and expectations are sky-high for what that could mean in industries ranging from capital markets trading, digital rights management, new peer-to-peer insurance models, and the internet of things.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Blockchain Engineering - JP Morgan

hackathon-eligibility:
Participant: Individuals 18 or over in age.
Team size is up to 5 members.
Prize money winners will likely be required to show government issued IDs to Sponsors; and additionally may require Tax form completion.
hackathon-requirements:
The objective is to create a new working prototype of an app, a DApp, a protocol, a platform etc. Your project may include hardware. 
It is recommended to have a full description of your project, and any slides on DevPost. However judges may not have time to review your DevPost submission.
hackathon-rules:
1) You must apply here and be approved before attending: https://www.coindesk.com/events/consensus-2018/hackathon
2) You and your team must all "Register for this hackathon" here at Devpost.
3) Team size is up to five members.
4) You must register your hackathon project here on Devpost and add all your team members.
5) To be able to present to the judges:
Rehearsals will be scheduled in 10 minute slots from ~8:00 am - noon. Rehearsal signups for Sunday morning will start Saturday afternoon, May 12.
6) You may present up to two slides.
Slide #1 should indicate: Team Name, Member Names, for which sponsor challenges you are competing.
Recommendations: Rehearse your pitch. Spend 30 seconds or less on your slide(s). Spend as much time as possible showing what you built over the weekend.
7) Read and abide by the Hackathon Code of Conduct:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize is 1 BTC (+ a Tierion swag bag :)
Prize will be ~$5,120 USD equivalent issued in NAS token
Induction into Interbit's Starting Block Program + $5,001.
$5,000 USD equivalent prize will be awarded in Bitcoin.
Prize is up to 4 Oculus Rift Virtual reality headsets (one per team member)
Winners will receive a Hyperledger Backpack with Hyperledger Swag
Each winning team member will receive Beats headphones, Blockstack swag and a half-day session with the Blockstack NYC team as well as ongoing coaching and support

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Use of Blockchain / distributed ledger technology
Is it big? is it small? is it just a hack?
Did you practice? Will an investor understand well enough to invest?

hackathon-location-address: 11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA
hackathon-description-header: Join us for a weekend of hacking, hustling, and deep-diving into the blockchain industry's most cutting edge DLT developer tools.
